title: Barcelona fined €300 for breaking rules when signing Antoine Griezmann
text:
• La Liga champions given fine by Spanish football federation • Barca broke rules by negotiating with under-contract player

La Liga champions Barcelona have been fined a minuscule €300 by the Spanish football federation (RFEF) after they were found to have broken the rules in their pursuit of €120m signing Antoine Griezmann from Atlético Madrid.

The France forward switched from Atlético to Barça in July after the Catalans exercised his release clause, although Atlético complained that negotiations took place when Griezmann was under contract with them.

The RFEF’s competition committee said in a statement on Thursday that Barça broke its rules by beginning negotiations with Griezmann while he was under contract with Atlético without their permission, but absolved the player of any responsibility.

Barça and Atlético were not immediately available for comment.
